Strategies to accelerate climate mitigation can be most effective at
accelerating and achieving transformative change when they are synchronized with transition processes
in systems. They address technological stage characteristics, take advantage of high
intervention points, and respond to societal dynamics
(Abson et al. 2017; Köhler et al. 2019; Geels et
. Gaps in knowledge remain on how
to tailor policy mixes, the interaction of enabling
technical transition insights to other types of systems, and how
to harness these insights to better shift development pathways.
Sustainable development and technological innovation: Synergies, trade
Policies that shift innovation in climate compatible directions can promote other development benefits,
r health, increased energy access, poverty alleviation and economic competitiveness
as climate mitigation policies trigger innovation that can be leveraged for promoting industrial
development, job creation and economic growth, both in terms of localizing low
technologies value chains as well as of increased energy efficiency and avoided carbon lock
. Innovation and technological change can also empower citizens. Grass
innovation promotes the participation of grass
as social movements and networks of
academics, activists and practitioners, and facilitate experimenting with alternative forms of knowledge
. Examples of ordinary people and entrepreneurs
pting and adapting technologies to local needs to address locally defined needs have been
technologies can empower citizens and communities in decentralized energy systems contributing not
only to a more sustainable but also
to a more democratic and fairer energy system
in this chapter, and Section 5.4 in Chapter 5).
Therefore, even though STI is an explicit focus of SDG 9, it is in fact an enabler of most SDGs
. Striving for synergies between innovation and technological change for climate
